name: Fort Smith National Historic Site
description: Explore life on the edge of frontier and Indian Territory through the stories of soldiers, the Trail of Tears, scandals, outlaws, and lawmen who pursued them. From the establishment of the first Fort Smith on December 25, 1817, to the final days of Judge Isaac C. Parker's jurisdiction over Indian Territory in 1896, Fort Smith National Historic Site preserves almost 80 years of history.
shortDescription: Explore life on the edge of frontier and Indian Territory through the stories of soldiers, the Trail of Tears, scandals, outlaws, and lawmen who pursued them. From the establishment of the first Fort ...

operatingHours.description:
The Gallows and Commissary are open during Visitor Center hours, which may vary by season. Please check Visitor Center Hours for more information.

Park grounds are open daily from 30 minutes before sunrise until 30 minutes after sunset.

climate.weatherDescription: Fort Smith weather includes four distinct, yet temperate seasons. Spring and fall are usually mild while late summer is hot and humid. During winter months, temperatures occasionally dip into the teens. Forecast often changes dramatically due to surrounding weather influences. Arkansas's central location allows weather systems from all directions to influence its climate. The area is prone to flash flooding and river flooding in rainy seasons.

images.title: Visitor Center
images.caption: The former barracks, courthouse, and jail serves as the park's visitor center

images.title: Commissary and Supply Wagon
images.caption: In 1845, Fort Smith was converted to a supply depot. With this mission, Fort Smith became one of the busiest supply posts in the southwest.

images.title: Entrance sign
images.caption: Entrance sign along the river trail on a snowy day.

images.title: Foundations of First Fort Smith
images.altText: Foundations of first Fort Smith and Arkansas River
images.caption: Foundations of the first Fort Smith with Arkansas River in the background

images.title: Jail Wagon and Gallows
images.caption: A jail wagon like this one was use the transport prisoners to the Federal Courthouse 6th Street.

images.title: Visitor Center in Spring
images.altText: The red brick visitor center framed by two redbud trees with a paved path leading to it.
images.caption: Redbud trees give a lively look to the park in spring.

images.title: Visitor Center in Winter
images.altText: A snow-covered Hawthorn bush partially obscures the red brick visitor center in the background.
images.caption: Snow might be present during a winter visit to the park.

images.title: Officers' Garden
images.altText: Purple and orange flowers bloom in the foreground with the red brick visitor center in the back.
images.caption: The Officers' Garden is maintained with assistance from the River Valley Master Gardeners.
